Press

Texas leads the nation in many ways, but we can’t be proud of ourselves as a state until this problem has been solved by our leaders and our local communities. Hunger doesn’t belong here. Celia Cole

Study Estimates 18.3 Percent of Texans Were “Food Insecure” in 2012

Published August 16, 2013

View All

Featured Work

  • Testimony to the Senate Finance Committee

    TFBN requests that Rider 15 be increased to $3.2 million, which would result in a $3M grant for Texas food banks. An increase to $3.2M would enable us to distribute roughly 40M lbs of Texas-grown produce to needy Texans in the next biennium.

  • SNAPshot: Who Benefits from Food Stamps in Texas

    Who benefits from food stamps in Texas? When it comes down to it, we all do. The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP, aka food stamps) is our nation’s front- line defense against hunger.

  • 2011 Small Area Income & Poverty Estimates

    2011 U.S. Census - Small Area Income & Poverty Estimates (SAIPE) data.

  • How do low-income texans get help feeding their children?

    Programs link SNAP, Summer Meals and After-School Meals are widely underutilized, and could reach many more children than they do currently.

  • Helping Texas Farmers and Hungry Texas Families

    An estimated 187,000 Texans currently receiving SNAP benefits could become ineligible as a result of nutrition title provisions in the House farm bill.

  • Helping Texas Farmers and Hungry Texas Families

    Administered by TDA, the Texans Feeding Texans (Surplus Ag) grant helps the Texas food banks provide hungry families with more than 12 pounds of Texas-grown produce for every $1.

  • Is categorical eligibility to blame for the growth of SNAP rolls?

    Not if you compare the states that have it to the states that don't.

From The Blog

Farm Bill Must Be Last Time Hungry Americans Are Made to Suffer

When Congress passed a farm bill, they included a provision that will sharply reduce SNAP (aka food stamps) benefits for 850,000 households in sixteen states over the next decade.
